We were not disappointed. The place is beautiful, our room was spotless, the service was outstanding, and breakfast was very tasty. We will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: A welcome respite from our travels

likes.liked: — Calm environment, helpful and welcoming staff, amazing red rock views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went on a jam-packed "sampler" tour of Arizona over 5 days in November. Much of our time was spent driving from place to place and making sure we saw as much as possible. Arriving at the Canyon Villa B&B for our last night marked the most relaxing part of our stay. Les greeted us at the door, gave us a tour of the premises, and showed us to our room--a large room with a fireplace and the most amazing view of Bell Rock. Indeed, the view of the rock from the "Scenic View" off the road was not nearly as breathtaking as the view from our own room. I promptly fell asleep in the bed that I may have been the most comfortable bed I've ever experienced! The afternoon hors d'oeuvres were wonderful and the nighttime cookies were also tasty. Les was very helpful with our dinner reservations, above and beyond what we would've expected. The next day's breakfast was savory and satisfying, getting us ready for the long day of travel ahead. Thanks to Les and Peg, we were given "back road" instructions on how to get to a beautiful creek and view away from the touristy parts of the area. I would definitely recommend Canyon Villa for a relaxing stay.
reviews.title: Looking for the Sun
One of the very best!
reviews.text: Our stay at Canyon Villa Inn over Thanksgiving was very enjoyable and relaxing. The staff and innkeepers were faultless. The innkeeper contacted us well in advance of our stay and offered to reserve us a table at a nearby restaurant for Thanksgiving dinner. Little personal touches like this really makes this B&B stand out from others we have visited. The daily 3 course breakfasts and nightly hors d'oeuvres were superb. The building is specifically designed as a B&B so the rooms are spacious and well laid out. We stayed in Manzanita which had a great private balcony and an unobstructed view of Bell Rock. We highly recommend this B&B and we are planning a return trip ourselves.

reviews.text: What a pleasant experience Canyon Villa was! I stayed at the Villa in mid October and found the hospitality, view, accomodations, and Peg's breaksfast were all so enjoyable. I would certainly recommend this place to others.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Canyon Villa Bed & Breakfast earlier this month and thought that it was delightful. I loved everything about the place -- the room was very cozy and decorated in the decor of Sedona; the living room & dining room had such a gorgeous view of the Red Rock Canyon; the breakfasts tasted so good; and the innkeepeers were so nice and accommodating. I would love to go back to this place sometime and hope that I can! Gail Rae Van Deusen, Walnut Creek, California
reviews.title: Great food,great owners,great location.Just great.

reviews.title: Michigan traveler
reviews.text: Great room(Octillo),great view,great breakfast,great section of the country,great owners who had an answer for every question we needed answered and were extremely helpful in arranging certain transactions and reservations for us.Just Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I've been travelling for business for over 25 years and I've stayed at all the chains, other B & B's, etc. But I have never experienced the level of hospitality, graciousness and warmth that Les and Peg show to their guests. I stayed here prior to a business convention in early January. I had the opportunity to experience a night in the Strawberry Cactus (the view is utterly breathtaking) and two nights in the Mariposa (beautiful view, fireplace charm, garden privacy). The rooms are spotless, the little touches (mini-chocolates deskside) delightful, and the breakfasts - well! the breakfasts are beyond delicious. The Inn itself is quiet. I was only a ten minute drive to downtown Sedona through the most beautiful stretch of road in the U.S. Hiking trails are across the street, and for those that must - there is an outlet mall across the street as well. Plenty of wonderful restaurants close by. Peg arranged a day trip to the Grand Canyon for me and two colleagues that was deluxe in every way. The box breakfasts that were waiting for us as we left for the tour were very much appreciated. All I can say is the Canyon Villa is A+++++++++
reviews.title: Fantastic!
A heavenly place
reviews.text: LES & PEG are exceptional Inkeepers.The views, the afternoon goodies,the breakfasts are supurb & a treat to every sense...........The Fehrs ..Montreal Canada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Canyon Villa Inn was the highlight of our three week vacation. The accomodations were excellent, the food was great and the views from our room were absolutly the best. The owner and staff met our every need, even accomodating us with no notice. They all were just great. We arrived unexpectely and were able to stay six days and then return for two more after a two day trip to the Grand Canyon. We feel that in a value to price comparison the Inn wins out hands down. There is no question that when we return to Sedona, we'll stay at the Canyon Villa Inn.
reviews.title: Terrific B&B

likes.liked: — Extremelt clean and comfortable with excellent service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited Sedona for the fisrt time in Oct. '06 for our 25th. anniversary. After much research and confusion we picked the Canyon Villa B&B and were thrilled . We arrived in the evening and couldn't see anything , but when we awoke the next morning it was just like the web site pictures. The mountains just grabbed you in with their enormous size & beauty. You have to see it yourself to get the total effect.. You can almost reach out and touch them. We stayed in the Octillo room which has the best view overlooking the gardens, pool, and Red Rocks. The room itself was very comfortable and the staff very accommadating. They serve a beautiful & delicious breakfast every morning. Don't miss the sticky buns; even if just a taste. I liked sitting at the large table with a variety of the guests and swapping information & stories of our adventures in Sedonia. The owners of Canyon Villa; Les & Peg were extremely pleasant and helpful with information about the area and things to do. The B&B's location is also very close to downdown Sedona, only about 10 minutes. In closing if we do return to Sedona in the future I would surely stay again at The Canyon Villa. We LOVED it.
reviews.title: Amazingly Breathtaking!
B & B in the shadow of a magical rock
reviews.text: There are 12 vortexes, or concentrated spots of energy and spirituality in the world, half of which are located in the huge red rocks surrounding Sedona, Arizona. At the foot of one of these vortexes, the so-called Bell Rock, is the Canyon Villa Bed and Breakfast. Prior to our stay there I scoffed at the notion of "magnetic spots of energy", but sometime during our stay I was convinced otherwise. From the moment we walked in the door to the last handshake as we reluctantly departed, we felt as if we had made a very special stop on our journey. This was a place filled with peacefulness, warmth and great conversations. The owners and other guests seemed like they were friends we already knew. Perhaps it was our room -the Desert Daisy (the rooms are given names, not numbers)- the patio door perfectly framed the glowing Bell Rock; or the cry of the coyote nearby; or maybe it was the scrumptious gourmet breakfasts which were different each day (their house specialty is a melt-in-your-mouth cinamon roll); or maybe the cozy library with tons of books left behind by past guests; or the spacious lounge area with huge fireplace; or the view of the surroundings; the delicious late afternoon tea welcoming you back "home"; the attention to detail and quality control. Perhaps it was the rocks of Sedona working their magic to make this a most memorable stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a fabulous four nights with Les and Peg in early October and loved every minute of our time in Sedona. We savored the fantastic views of the red rocks (we stayed in two different rooms on the upper floor) in our well appointed rooms. The gourmet breakfasts were delightful and they were most accommodating to my meatless diet. We also enjoyed the appetizers and homemade cookies. Peg and Les were helpful in suggesting great hikes and restaurants. This was our first trip to Sedona, but we will definitely return to Canyon Villa in the near future.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose Canyon Villa B & B for our 2 night stay in Sedona for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. It exceeded our already high expectations. Les and Peg are gracious hosts, and the other staff with whom we had contact was as well. Our room was beautifully decorated and comfortable, with much attention to small details. The view was breathtaking. Breakfast was exceptional and dinner recommendations were right on target. Any request we had was handled expediently and any question was answered expertly. It was truly an experience we will never forget. We would, without hesitation, recommend Canyon Villa to anyone looking for a beautiful, clean, comfortable and unforgettable place to stay in Sedona.
reviews.title: Great spot for a few days in Sedona

likes.disliked: — Not much..bathroom was a little out of date, but didn't bother us too much. Also, they specifically requested us to write a review upon leaving - they were nice about it, but I generally think managers shouldn't ask this of guests - just let it happen naturally.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family (wife, two tweens, and mother) stayed at Canyon Villa for two nights in December 2008 (booked nearly a year ahead of time) near the beginning of a big winter road trip vacation swinging from the Southwest through the mid-West. I had done a lot of research before selecting our accommodations in Sedona, and of course I was glad to see that the effort had paid off, as the visit to Canyon Villa was quite nice. We had the Ocotillo and Spanish Bayonet rooms. The views from the rooms and the common areas are as spectacular as advertised, and the breakfasts and snacks were terrific, too. Les and Peg's recommendations for dining and activities were spot-on (great meals at Dahl and Deluca's as well as Shugrue's, and fun times by all with horseback riding and hiking), but best of all was just their sheer hospitality. Not a single negative thing to say about the experience; highly recommended!
reviews.title: Terrific B&B
Spectacular Views, Definitely rates as a "Distinguished Inn"
reviews.text: Everything about this Inn was perfect. Staff were very cordial and efficient. Rooms were all unique and beautifully appointed. Common area and pool had spectacular views as did second floor rooms. Inn is located at the end of quiet street and is within walking distance of restaurants and a host of nature walking trails. Sunrise from our balcony was remarkable. Bring a bottle of wine and enjoy the late afternoon around the pool with complementary hors d'oeuvres. Great breakfast and the staff will make anything you want if you have specific dietary requirements.

reviews.title: Make this a "Bucket List" destination!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: A wonderful Sedona experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Canyon Villa is the perfect getaway. It is in a beautiful location surrounded by the most awesome views of Bell Rock. The owners, Les & Peg are fantastic hosts. The rooms are very comfortable, clean and quite. The breakfasts were outstanding. The afternoon hors d'oeuvres were the best anyone could want. We have been staying at B&B’s for the past 15 years and the Canyon Villa is the finest. If you like the other Select Registry B&B’s you will absolutely love the Canyon Villa. I rank the Canyon Villa as the benchmark for others to attain.
reviews.title: Awesome Canyon Villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I choose the Canyon Villa for our anniversary stay in Sedona,and could not have been more pleased. The owners and staff were as nice as they could be, helping us make reservations for dinner and booking sightseeing trips. The rooms are all different, but what they have in common is that they were immaculate and extremely comfortable. The views surronding the property are just as described, beautiful! The food served at breakfast was fresh and original, and changed daily. There was always coffee, tea and ice water 24 hrs a day, unique appetizers every afternoon, and cookies and sweets at night. The Canyon Villa Bed and Breakfast made our stay in Sedona one of the best we have ever had. We would reccommend it highly and should we ever go back to Sedona, would not hesistate to stay there again. It is a must!!
reviews.title: Canyon Villa, WOW!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: After exhaustively researching through so many reviews of hotels and inns on tripadvisor we decided to book our entire seven nite stay in Sedona at The Canyon Villa and we're so glad we did. As soon as you enter the Inn you feel such a warm inviting atmosphere. Upon entering, you pass thru a large, open, cozy living room. It has a beatiful working fireplace with vaulted ceilings and attached library with a computer providing internet access for guests. The livingroom and dining area have an absolutely breathtaking view of Couthouse Butte and Bell Rock through huge floor to ceiling windows. The view is awe-inspiring...from the sunrises to the sunsets, it is always changing. I could sit by those windows all day mesmerized by the view. Upon entering our room I was thrilled to find that we had the same amazing view. The entire place was immaculate. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. The breakfasts and before-dinner appetizers were delicious. Les and Peg could not have been more welcoming and helpful in recommending and booking our activities and dinner reservations. They both showed a genuine concern for every aspect of our trip and our stay with them. We cannot wait to return.
reviews.title: It Doesn't Get Better Than This!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled to Sedona the first week of November 2006. We had actually made prior reservations in August to stay this week at another B&B. Due to construction deadlines being pushed out, that B&B canceled. We were provided a list of alternates. After researching I contacted Canyon Villa. My husband and I were not disappointed! We stayed in 2 different rooms: Manzanita and Indian Paintbrush. I would recommend either room. Manzinata is upstairs w/balcony. Indian Paintbrush is on ground floor with door wall leading into patio/garden. You will find beautiful views and wonderful food at this B&B. We have stayed at many B&Bs, this is not our first experience. We would put this in our top 3 in the country. Les & Peg are wonderful owners/innkeepers and all their staff are very pleasant and accommodating. We were given great dinner recommendations as well. Another perk is that the property is actually in the Village of Oak Creek, so you avoid additional taxing that you would pay in the Sedona city limits.
reviews.title: Wonderful Sedona B&B
wonderful
reviews.text: Every year we take a large group in december and go to a bed and breakfast in Sedona. We had for the last few years went to casa sedona but they had changed managment and unfortunatly were not so friendly. ( If you read this Casa Sedona we brought a group of 17 and took 9 rooms). We have found a new home at Canyon Villa. The staff was wonderful even made changes to the menu to facillitate a diet and also food alergies from another member. They were thoughtful in countless ways. The rooms and everything were clean beyond reproach and every room had a spectacular view mostly of bell rock and courthouse butte. I would please ask anyone reading this to please contact me if they want a guests perspective. I can be reached at vegasskydiver@cox.com. We cant wait till our visit to Canyon Villa next year.

aka: Canyon Villa Bed And Breakfast Inn Of Sedona Hotel
description: Known around the world as "The Inn With the Million Dollar Views," Canyon Villa Inn offers spectacular views of the famous Red Rocks of Sedona, AZ, from 10 of its 11 luxury guestrooms as well as from common areas and the glass tiled swimming pool. True 3 course gourmet breakfast and afternoon appetizer hour included for all guests. Come for our views and stay for our hospitality. NO Resort Fees. Member of Select Registry, Distinguished Inns of North America.
